climbs.name: Unknown route between Shape Shifter and Joker

content.description: A nice little route.  The first bolt is a ways up but it's easy to get to.  The crux is the bulge past the second bolt.
content.protection: 2 bolts - you can get a medium wire in a few feet above the 2nd bolt or a cam a bit higher - the cam messes up the hand jam though.

content.description: This is the farthest left route on Super Slabs. Face climb with no protection for 15’ to the route’s only bolt. Step over the small bulge to the right- leaning crack which is followed for 15’ to the deep, vertical crack. This leads to the two bolt anchor which has hangers but no chains.
content.location: The climb starts just left of the northernmost tree on the west face.

content.description: Wow, this climb packs multiple hard sections with scant protection. It is difficult as soon as you leave the ground and stays that way until you finish traversing left to the upper crack. It is probably best to TR the route due to groundfall potential for the first 18-20’.
content.protection: One bolt, wires, cams to 3”, and a good head.
content.location:
This is located between the bolted routes Mammoristick Tendencies and

The Pink Nipple

. The start is 6’ right of the northernmost tree on the west face.

content.description: Nice friction climbing right of Pink Nipple
content.protection: 3 bolts and a medium wire; chains

content.description: I can't tell whether this is Riddler or Temporal Anomaly in Cowan's guide.  The description matches Riddler best so I'll assume that's it.  Another good slab route.  Clipping the 3rd bolt is tough!  Going straight up at this bolt is really hard - it's much easier to work up on the right.
content.protection: Bolts.  Bring a blue Alien for extra pro while clipping the 3rd bolt.

content.description: An excellent slab route immediately left of Shape Shifter.

This is one of the only true splitter-ish climbs at Hartmans. Walk around the South end of Super Slab to an obvious crack that expands from tips to wide off-width. A short but intense jam-fest that will test your pain tolerance. Tape is recommended.
content.protection: It is a short climb so the gear is minimal. Starts with a #2 TCU or C3 then takes #0.75-#4 Camalots. Maybe bring a #5 if it makes you feel good. You can sling (20ft of webbing or cord) the top of the left part of the detached pillar that makes the crack and lower to clean the route. Then have someone who is less tired scramble up the backside to recover the webbing/cord.
content.location: South side of Super Slab, climb the obvious crack.

content.description: A slab ending in a bulge right of Shape Shifter.  The crux mantle is well protected but pretty stout
